Strange ghostly forms appear and disappear in the distance. They seem like apparitions. Broken timbers and dangling cables emerge from the smoky  light. We see hints of a huge demolished space. dialogues.text: We're going to the theatre. She wants  to see "Macbeth" at the Spring Street  Repertory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl winces. Sam smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Molly are sitting in the fifth row of a crowded  auditorium. He is sound asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scene from "Macbeth". Sam begins to snore. Molly grabs his nose. He jerks awake Molly grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright marquee lights sparkle overhead as Sam and Molly e the theatre. It is a beautiful brisk night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I loved it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and squeezes his arm. They walk silently down dark street, heading toward their loft. The pavement is f of shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Did I tell you what Marcia said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six? No I didn't. Sam, don't be so  blasГ©. I'll have two major pieces in  the show. The New York Times reviews  her gallery all the time. This could  be huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, the "New York Times" is some  frustrated little critic with pimples  on his ass who flunked out of art  school. Who cares what The New York  Times thinks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight million readers, that's who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your work's beautiful. That's a fact,  Moll. It doesn't matter what anyone  thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can tell from the expression on Molly's face that it d Sam puts his arm around her. She nestles close to him. Th suddenly, she stops and looks up. There is an unexpected  seriousness in her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I want to marry you, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taken aback) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about it for days.  More than thinking. I want to do it.  I want to jump in whole hog... (she pauses) What is that look for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at her) It's just been so long since... I  mean, you never wanted to talk about  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you love me, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, Moll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come you never say it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say "ditto". It's not the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People say "I love you" all the time.  It doesn't mean anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes you need to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stops and stares at Molly. He pauses quietly. He is a to speak when A MAN'S FACE emerges from the shadows behin him. Molly gasps. Sam spins around.

dialogues.speaker: AN INTENSE LOOKING MAN
dialogues.text: is standing in the darkness between two buildings. He sta at the couple for a moment and then steps onto the sidewa Sam and Molly stand motionless. The man hesitates and the begins walking the other way. Molly exhales a deep breath Sam takes Molly's arm and they continue briskly down the  street. Suddenly they hear FOOTSTEPS coming after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me handle this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam stops abruptly and turns around. A gun is staring him the face. Molly screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wallet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam waits a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam reaches for his jacket. The Mugger grabs his wrist an then carefully pulls the wallet out himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the money. Just leave the wallet  and my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swipes Sam across the head. Molly screams. The Mugger  whacks her across the face. Sam explodes, plowing into th mugger with all his might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a wild, all out brawl. Sam fights like a mad man Suddenly the GUN goes off. The Mugger panics and takes of running. Sam charges after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men run down the dark street, but the Mugger is  already a full block ahead and disappears into the shadow Sam gives up. Slowly he turns and begins walking back tow Molly. We can see Molly dimly at the end of the block as Sam  approaches. She is screaming for help. Frightened, Sam ca out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer. Sam tenses and starts running toward  her. He is just three feet away when suddenly he stops. A expression of pure terror overwhelms his face.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: drenched in blood. Her eyes are glazed, on the verge of s Panting, she stoops down to the curb as THE CAMERA TRAVEL WITH HER. She grabs hold of something lying in the shadow and pulls it toward her. It is Sam's dead body she is holding in her arms. Sam's ghostly form, still solid to all appearances, stand beside Molly. His eyes are awash in horror and confusion. seems unable to move. THE CAMERA HOLDS on his face as the full impact of his situation dawns in his eyes. Suddenly he lets out a blood-curdling scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumps down toward his body and reaches out to grab hol of his motionless form. His hands make a strange SOUND as they pass right though it. It is terrifying. Sam jumps up crazed, frenzied, and begins circling Molly. It is as tho he is trying to undo what has been done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This isn't happening. It's not  happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches out to Molly for help. His hand cuts through h shoulder. He screams. FOOTSTEPS. People are running down the street. The sound SIRENS can be heard in the distance. Two MEN run toward S He yells out at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run right through him. He gasps in stunned terror. Sam watches helplessly as they reach his body. Molly look up and begins screaming hysterically. One of the Men grab her as the other goes for Sam's wrist. There is no sign o life. The first Man holds Molly back as his friend stoops down begins some form of cardio-pulmonary resuscitation. There no response. Sam bends down, trying desperately to help. is a futile gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it! Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man bangs on Sam's chest. Blood gushes from the wound Molly recoils. He bangs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam shoots up in bed, panting. It is dark. He stares arou the loft in sudden confusion. With a lurch he flicks on t night light. Molly is lying beside him, her head buried  beneath a pillow. Sam seems stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly? Molly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears stream down his face. Molly stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam? What's the matter? Is something  wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is so relieved to hear her voice that he can hardly  breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, groggy, tries to sit up. Sam reaches out for her. As she turns around, we see A SKELETEL VERSION OF HER HEA staring at the camera. It speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking him) What is it, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam bolts upright, screaming. It is a scream so consumed terror that one fears it will never stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: asleep in bed. He is thrashing at his pillow and moaning. Suddenly, a hand reaches out and touches his shoulder. Sa jumps straight up in bed and kicks wildly at the sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is sitting on the bed looking at him, afraid. Sam stares down at her. He is breathing heavily, not trus his own senses. His hands clutch at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening to me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a brilliant white light shoots into the room as host of glowing forms, radiating an intense inner light,  float before us. A blinding tunnel spirals in an infinite vortex behind them. Sam is awed and confused. We sense th the light is enchanting him. The entire room begins to  disappear in the light. Molly screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave me. I need you, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns and sees Molly, only she is not in the bed. She back on the street. To his amazement, he is on the street too, still bathed in the soothing light. Frightened, he c out to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does not hear him. He calls again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no response. Sam, deeply troubled, hesitates for moment. He is torn between Molly and the light. Then, in painful, but conscious gesture, he turns from the light a walks toward Molly. At that instant, the light behind him disappears with the sound of a pneumatic door closing. Th is a sense of terrible finality as the tunnel evaporates  into the void. Sam is left on the dark pavement. He stand there a moment, as if in shock, and then begins running t Molly. An AMBULANCE is rounding the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swirls of light speed toward the ambulance as car headlig and streetlamps merge in a wild dizzying rush. The SIREN  wails into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's body is lying in the back of the ambulance as a  PARAMEDIC applies electric paddles to his chest in an eff to save him. After a moment, he looks up at Molly. We can tell from the expression in his eyes that it is hopeless. Sam yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stop! I'm not dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, kneeling over Sam's body, grabs him and begins to in long terrible sobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOCTOR, comforting Molly, accompanies her from one of t emergency operating rooms and leads her through a pair of swinging doors into a separate waiting area. We see TWO  POLICEMEN and TWO DETECTIVES stand up and approach her. Sam doesn't want Molly to go and begins to follow her, bu then seems torn, afraid to leave his body. He turns back  just as his corpse, covered in a green sheet, is wheeled  into the corridor and parked alongside the wall. Sam seem stunned and inconsolable as he sits down beside it. A wrinkled OLD MAN approaches Sam and joins him on the be He begins talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is startled, amazed that the man can see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're new, huh? I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you talking to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax. It ain't like before, you  know. It's a whole new ball-a-wax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm waiting for my wife. She's in  4C. Cardiac wing. She's fighting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man sticks his head into the green sheet covering Sam body. His head disappears. Sam is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Shot, huh? That'll do it every time.  Poor bastard. Well, get used to it.  You could be here a long time. (leaning in close) I'll tell you a secret. Doors ain't  as bad as you think. Zip zap. They  ain't nothin' at all. You'll see.  You'll catch on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly there is a loud COMMOTION and we see several  PHYSICIANS operating furiously on an Old Man lying on the table beside them. It is a life threatening situation and they seem to be failing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He ain't gonna make it. I've seen it  a million times. He's a goner. See?  Here they come. Lucky bastard. Could  have been the other ones. You never  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Sam can understand what is happening the entire ro fills with a strange preternatural light. Suddenly he loo up and freezes. The amorphous forms he saw right after he died are floati down through the ceiling and reaching for the body on the operating table. They are emitting a powerful light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, we're losing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I tell you? Bingo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glowing forms take hold of the man's spirit and help  extract it from his body. His physical form changes insta from a solid object into an ethereal substance. Sam stares in amazement as the strange beings carry the s upward. They evaporate through the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light in the room grows dull instantly. Nurses cover dead man with a dark sheet as the doctors step away. Sam  turns to the Old Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? What's happening...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Man isn't there. An Orderly approaches the gurney wit Sam's body and begins pushing it toward the elevator. Sam jumps in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the stretcher begins to roll right through him. The  penetration of his physical space is horrifying to Sam. H stands, almost paralyzed, as the body of the Orderly  intersects with his. It is a stunning moment of extraordi strangeness as we witness the atoms and molecules of the  Orderly's body passing through his. It is like a glimpse ultimate chaos, the universe within. Then, in a flash, the Orderly has passed through, but Sam still shaking. He stares up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the ceiling lights and acoustical tiles begin to blur. The hallway grows dark. It is as though Sam is blacking o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, images begin to emerge out of the blackness. It t a moment to realize that they are scenes from Sam's funer The CAMERA TRACKS along rows of mourners as seen from SAM P.O.V. He seems to be floating among them. We hear snippe of conversations. It all seems strangely odd and disjoint Time seems unfixed, malleable. We see a MINISTER standing beside the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As we say farewell to our friend Sam  Wheat, we are reminded of his  kindness, his generosity, his buoyancy  of spirit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA KEEPS MOVING. Sam's associates from the bank a among the mourners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) All that we treasure, our friends,  our loved ones, our body, our mind,  are but on loan to us. We must  surrender them all. We are all  travelers on the same road which  leads to the same end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam notices a WOMAN in a fancy print dress comforting one the mourners. The woman looks up at him, smiles, and wave Sam is surprised. He looks behind him, but no one is ther As he turns back, the woman is walking away. She appears  just like any normal person until she approaches a large  gravestone and passes right through it. Sam is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As our loved one enters eternal life,  let us remember that love, too, is  eternal, that although we will miss  him, our love will light the void  and dispel the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Molly ENTERS THE FRAME. Sam spots her. The CAME STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does not respond. RUTH, her sister, leans over to her Tears form in Molly's eyes. A hand reaches out to give he tissue. Molly looks up. It is Carl. She gives him her han He squeezes it with affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and into Your hands we commend  his spirit. May he rest in peace. In  the name of the Father, the Son, and  the Holy Ghost. Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The casket is lowered into the ground. Molly approaches t grave. She us a little unsteady. Carl takes her elbow. A  shovel is placed in her hands. With great emotional effor she lifts a shovelful of dirt and tosses it onto the cask It lands with a REVERBERATING finality. Sam shudders.

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE
dialogues.text: leaving the cemetery. We hear them talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time you going back to work?...  What's the buzz on Digital? It's  sad. He was so young... How's your  new Honda?... Going away this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: desperately alone. Down the hill, people are getting back into their cars. Sam can see Molly being let into a limou He stands there staring at his own casket, grieving. Then after a moment, he turns away. Separating from his body,  from his own grave site, he runs after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is sitting on the couch in the middle of the loft  surrounded by FRIENDS and WELL WISHERS. A young GIRL, her niece, cuddles in her lap. People are eating and milling  around. Slowly THE CAMERA BEGINS TO PAN. It ends on Sam,  standing alone in a corner. In the midst of all the activ he is lost and alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raw clay on a potter's wheel spins hypnotically, sensuous Molly's wet hands press in, shaping it, molding it. A bow begins to appear. The camera pulls back and reveals Sam. is sitting on the floor behind her, knees pressed to his  chest, rocking aimlessly. Molly looks away from the bowl she is forming. It distort and bends. Angry, she digs her finger into it. The bowl  disintegrates. Tears form in her eyes. Frank jumps up on the bench beside her. Molly stares sadl around the room. Quietly, she begins talking to herself, the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, Sam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I picked up your shirts this morning.  I don't know why. Mr. Reynolds said  to tell you hello. I broke into tears.  It's so hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks over to Molly. Desperate for contact, he reache out to touch her cheek, but then hesitates and pulls back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I think about you every minute. It's  like you're still here, like I can  feel you, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at her, hoping, wondering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am here, Moll. I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, as if hearing Sam's voice, the cat begins to hi Molly spins around. The cat scans the room. Unexpectedly, Sam's and the cat's eyes meet... With a wild SCREECH, the cat jumps from the bench and takes off running. Sam recoi Molly stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, what's wrong? Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat is nowhere to be seen. All of a sudden, Molly fre Sam is standing right beside her. It is almost as though senses his presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; whispering) Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds very still for a moment. Sam watches breathless loving her, wanting her. Then quietly, hopefully, he reac out. It is a useless gesture. In a moment of great poigna Molly shakes her head and walks right through him. He rem IN THE FRAME, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, stands in the corner of a large, walk-in closet, wat as Molly goes through his effects. Boxes, scattered under are filling up with his life's possessions. Molly reaches for a shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Moll. Not that one. That's my  favorite...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses it into a box and then takes down a sweater. I is obviously handmade, about four sizes too big. Sam  recognizes it. Molly holds the sweater tenderly and presses it to her ch After a moment she puts it back. Then, in a surprising  outburst, she cries out and begins flailing at the shelve Everything comes flying off. Sam reaches out to console h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Molly, don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unexpectedly, Carl comes rushing into the room. He takes  hold of Molly and sits her on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Say something. Help her, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard. It's very hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Oh good. That's really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Carl are standing over the kitchen table foldin piles of Sam's clothes and placing them into boxes. As Mo lifts one of Sam's jackets, something falls from a side  pocket. It is his small black leather address book. Sam s at it with recognition. Carl sees the book fall and stoop to pick it up but Molly gets it first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's address book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She skims through it a moment, but the memories it evokes are too powerful for her. She places it carefully into a labeled "Sam's Things -- Valuable" and continues packing. She finds the old jar with the penny in it. It's marked " Luck". She holds it tenderly for a moment and then places on the nightstand beside the bed. Carl discovers some old ticket stubs in another of Sam's  jackets. He examines them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave Brubeck. Newport '86. Should I  toss 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, we hated that concert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes the stubs and lovingly puts them in the box. Sa groans. Carl finds a half used package of Rolaids. Molly takes th from his hand and puts them in the box, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you want to save those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolaids? What are you doin' Moll?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly just stares for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss him, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl comes over and takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly buries her head on his shoulder. Carl strokes her h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl lifting a pile of boxes and carrying them to the doo Suddenly Molly yells out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Wait. Not that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries over and pulls the "Valuable" box from the st in his arms. He looks at it with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. I'm sorry. I don't know  how that got in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to the door and then back to Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hey, Moll. Why don't you come? It's  like summer outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for a stroll. It'd be good to  get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly shakes her head and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, annoyed, walks over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly... you're not the one who died!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly stops and looks at him. He has struck home. After a moment she nods her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Just a short walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gently squeezes her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thata girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Sam even understands what is happening, they are  exiting the loft. Sam jumps up and runs after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Molly! Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slams shut. Sam is locked inside. Frightened and desperate, he rushes for the door knob. His hand sinks th it. There is a strange sound, like ELECTRICAL STATIC, as penetrates the metal and wood. Frightened, he yanks it ba Sam circles the space several times and then returns to t door. Clenching his teeth, he reaches out again. As his h pushes up against it, we sense that he experiences a subt resistance. The hairs on the back of his hand vibrate as ghostly form presses into it. We sense Sam's fear as his  entire arm DISAPPEARS FROM VIEW. The grating ELECTRICAL S shudders up his spine. The sight of his amputated limb is unsettling but Sam doe not pull back. Slowly he edges in and presses his face in the molecules of the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as atoms and electrons spin past him at frightening speed There is a sense of a universe in total chaos. Terrifying SOUNDS charge through his body.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: pulling back from the door. He is trembling.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA MOVES SLOWLY THROUGH THE LOFT AND GRADUALLY
dialogues.text: DISCOVERS SAM. He is sitting in a corner singing quietly himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Singing bye bye, Miss American Pie.  Drove my Chevy to the levy, but the  levy was dry. Them good ol' boys  were drinkin' whiskey and rye, and  singing this'll be the day that I..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, realizing the last word of the song. He sits  silently, staring at the wall. Suddenly, there is a SOUND at the door. Sam's eyes shoot The door begins to open. Sam stands up. His face begins to tighten. We know instan that something is wrong. His eyes fill with a fury we hav not seen before. The Mugger, the man who killed Sam, is entering the loft. has a key in his hand and puts it in his pocket. Sam is  stunned. The Mugger locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam goes wild. He shoots at the man with all his might,  attacking him unceasingly, but with no effect. His hands feet pass right through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You motherfucking bastard! What the  hell are you doing here? What are  you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mugger, unaware that anything is going on, glances ar nervously as he moves through the vast space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entering the bedroom, the Mugger goes to the dresser and  quickly examines the drawers. He is very neat, careful to leave no sign that he was there. He seems to be looking f something but cannot find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly we hear a KEY TURNING in the front door. The Mug seems startled. He dashes from the bedroom and hides quic behind one of the large sculptures. We hear the door OPEN Molly is standing there. Sam goes crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, no! Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly closes the door and locks it shut. Sam freezes as s heads for the bedroom. She walks right past the Mugger. T Sam's horror she stops and turns to look around. There is curious expression on her face. Seeing nothing she contin through the loft. The Mugger pulls out his gun. Sam looks on in absolute te Molly's purple blouse hits the floor as she begins to rem her clothes. She turns on the radio. Sam doesn't know what to do. The Mugger seems excited by  Molly's semi-nudity. He begins skirting the edges of the  loft, moving toward the bedroom. Sam is crazed. Suddenly, out of nowhere, Frank appears at the Mugger's f Sam's eyes light up. He drops to his knees, crawls over t him, glares into his eyes, and screams.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAT
dialogues.text: SCREECHES and jumps straight up. His claws shoot out at t mugger's face, ripping into the flesh near his eye. Blood appears. The mugger sees it dripping through his  fingers. The sight of it upsets him. He grabs the cat ang by the neck. It SQUEALS. Molly in her bra, peers from the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mugger holds the cat's mouth shut. Seeing and hearing nothing, Molly steps back into the bedroom. The Mugger takes the cat and throws it across the floor.  Holding his eye, he gets up and rushes for the exit. Sam  runs after him, but the door closes before he can get thr He is left inside.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: stares at the closed door in a wild panic. He doesn't kno what to do. Then, summoning all of his courage, he takes blind, running slow motion leap and charges through it. SAM'S P.O.V. There is a brief sense of passing through a molecular for field, a miniature universe inside the door.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: as he emerges from the door and lands on the other side. seems excited to have survived and is very pleased with  himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mugger steps out onto the sidewalk and hurries toward the subway. A patch of sleeve soaks up the blood from his eye. Sam starts after the man but instantly freezes. Hordes of people crowd the sidewalk. The crush of humanity is  frightening. Two lovers, holding hands, are coming right him. Before Sam is able to move, we hear the sound of the arms cutting through his ghostly form. Sam tries instinctively to dodge the crowds but people  approach him from all angles. We hear a BABY CARRIAGE roll through Sam's feet and he ne falls over trying to avoid it. His instincts will not let go. A barrage of images and SOUNDS assaults Sam. It is more t he can handle. Still, he refuses to give up. He stays clo to the Mugger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mugger heads down a flight of steps into the IRT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mugger gets onto a crowded subway car. Sam stands nea corner of the train watching him. Suddenly, Sam notices that something odd is happening. On of the riders at the other end of the car is walking towa him. As he approaches the Mugger, he does not stop, but p right through him. It takes Sam a moment to realize what happening, but then it is too late.

dialogues.speaker: THE OTHER GHOST
dialogues.text: With unholy fury the New Ghost charges into Sam. The atta is so unexpected and ferocious that Sam has no sense of h to defend himself. With unexpected power, the Ghost grabs hold of him and slams him into the subway door. Sam's hea plows right through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on Sam's head sticking outside of the car as the subway t rushes past him. There is a panicked look on his face. Th look intensifies as he turns and sees another train barre down on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: on Sam's body inside the car still struggling with the Gh as the other train shoots by the window. With a huge gasp Sam shoots back into the car, and wrests himself free of Ghost's hold. The Ghost flies after him, screeching. Sam surges through the door at the end of the train and f himself on the bridge between the subway cars. The subway Ghost stares at him through the window with a wild, insan look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay off! This is mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With shocking impact, the Ghost's fist goes flying into t window. To Sam's terror and amazement, the window SHATTER The Ghost smiles. Passengers scream and Sam dives for cov Sam stares at the broken glass with fascination and confu Suddenly, the train moves from the darkness of the tunnel into broad daylight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train stops at an elevated subway platform in Brookly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam sees the Mugger exiting the train and frantically rus after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam follows the Mugger down a long covered staircase to t street.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 321 PROSPECT PLACE
dialogues.text: The Mugger heads toward 321 Prospect Place. The streets a lined with old apartment buildings. Many windows are boar up. TWO MEN, standing on the corner, are slamming a piece heavy machinery onto the pavement. Sam hears GOSPEL MUSIC coming from a storefront church an notices a sign, "SISTER ODA MAE BROWN, MEDIUM, SPIRIT REA ADVISOR." He looks up to a third story window and sees a  similar sign with day-glo arrows pointing to the entrance the street. He seems curious, but then realizes that the  Mugger is nearly halfway down the block. He turns and rus after him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. 321 PROSPECT PLACE
dialogues.text: Sam and the mugger approach a tenement building at 321  Prospect Place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam follows the Mugger into the building and watches as h opens the mail box for APT. 4D. The name scribbled across is WILLIE LOPEZ. There's no mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam enters Willie's apartment. It is a squalid affair. Pe paint chips litter the floor. The bed is unmade. Willie pulls open a drawer in a small nightstand and drop in the keys to Molly's loft. Sam sees his wallet. His dri license, bank ID, and a photo of Molly are there, too.  Furious, Sam lunges for Willie but then holds his punch,  knowing it will have no effect. He turns instead to a win and, like the Ghost on the subway, smashes it with his fi Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie dials the phone. Someone comes on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She came home. I couldn't get it.  Give me a couple of days. I'll go  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Sam stares at him in wild confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get what? Who the hell are you? What  were you doing at Molly's? What the  hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie grabs a bottle of wine from the nightstand and lie down. After a moment he reaches over and takes Molly's ph from the drawer. He studies it slowly. Sam stands by the door in a state of motionless rage. The is nothing he can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Stay away from her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam storms down the street. His movements seem undirected utterly aimless. He is seething inside. Suddenly Sam looks up. An old BAG LADY is walking down th street talking loudly to a SHORT WOMAN tagging along besi her. As they approach a street pole, the Bag Lady swerves the side. The Short Woman, however, walks right through i Passersby laugh at the Old Lady talking to herself. Sam,  unsettled, rushes away. As Sam rounds a corner, a sudden blast of MUSIC explodes of nowhere. Sam jumps into the street, gasping. A phonogr needle SCRATCHES across a record and the MUSIC STOPS. A  woman's voice booms out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry 'bout that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to a pair of loudspeakers in a storefront window. The MUS blares out once more and SOUNDS of gospel fill the street Sam looks up. He is back in front of the storefront churc with the sign for SISTER ODA MAE BROWN, MEDIUM, SPIRIT RE ADVISOR, hanging overhead. Below it is another sign. "Con the dearly departed. $20.00". Sam stares at the sign with curiosity. The MUSIC is  compelling. After a moment's hesitation, he goes in the o door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A record player is sitting near the storefront window, a  makeshift microphone placed in front of it. Several rows of folding chairs face a raised platform wit nothing on it. A number of people are sitting there, most women. One gets the sense that this is a cross between a  waiting room and a meeting hall. A black WOMAN steps up o the platform and calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosa Santiago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. SANTIAGO tucks a Spanish paperback romance into her  purse and heads to a door at the rear of the hall. Sam fo after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Santiago enters a dark room with a window and door  leading to a side street. A paisley bedspread is tacked o the window. In the center of the room is a round seance table. Two  heavyset sisters, CLARA (39), and LOUISE (36), are standi beside an open closet. It is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please be seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Santiago sits at the table. She seems apprehensive.  Clara steps into the closet and taps on each of the walls though demonstrating that they are solid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister will be with us soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps back out and closes the door. Louise inserts a  tape into a boom box and then steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Oda Mae. Grant us the gift of  your all-seeing presence. Appear for  us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back to the closet and opens the door. Like mag ODA MAE BROWN, 41, appears standing inside. She is a blac woman in a white tunic. The whiteness of her garment make it look as if she is glowing in the dark. Mrs. Santiago i wide-eyed. Sam smiles as Oda Mae steps into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Santiago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buenos dias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a twenty dollar bill from her purse and hands i to Oda Mae. Clara graciously intercepts the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you are hoping to contact  your husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si. Si.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I believe he's gonna be with  us today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, tsank you, tsank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears well up in her eyes. She crosses herself several ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's no telling about the  other world. You gotta cast out all  doubt. You gotta believe. Do you  believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding her head  vigorously) Si. Si. I believe. I believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And remember, we don't make no  promises. I can phone up there till  I'm blue in the face, (she points to the  ceiling) ...but it don't necessarily mean  he's gonna be home. Them folks go  shopping, they play bingo. It's just  like here. You can't always get 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Santiago, utterly fascinated, nods understandingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure lady!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae's eyes glance up curiously for a second, as thoug she heard something, and then she continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's get ready then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam steps back as the sisters get up and position themsel behind Oda Mae. The moment feels rehearsed, theatrical. O Mae raises her hands into the air and closes her eyes. Th is a hush in the room. Her body begins to tremble. Mrs.  Santiago clutches her chair. Suddenly Oda Mae breaks out her trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a problem here. I don't think  he's in. Wait. I feel something. Did  he know someone who's passed over,  someone named Anna... Mary...  Consuela... Maria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Si, si! His mama. She's Maria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah! I knew it. He's with his mama.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae's eyes dart uncomfortably around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid this is gonna be too hard.  Now I got two souls I gotta contact.  I don't know about that. It's  difficult, you know. The pain. The  effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pay more. How much? How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go. Milk her for every penny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae jumps up and stares at her sisters. They look bac at her curiously. They can't figure out what's wrong. Nei can Oda Mae. Mrs. Santiago reaches into her purse. A twenty dollar bil changes hands. Sam watches, amazed at it all. Oda Mae sit down and goes back into her trance. Her eyeballs roll up  into their sockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praise the Lord. Thank you, Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae is beginning to shake again. The two women grab h shoulders to keep her from falling out of the chair. Sudd her whole body stiffens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Have mercy! Have mercy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Santiago stares on in amazement. After a moment Oda  Mae's body collapses in a heap. Then, like a phoenix risi from the ashes, she pulls herself up in her chair and ass a normal pose. After several seconds to get her bearings, Oda Mae begins speak. Only now she has an entirely new voice. It sounds  deep and hoarse, like an old man's. For all its put on  theatricality, it is strangely convincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome, Rosa Santiago. You are  fortunate today. The channel is clear.  Many spirits are gathering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scanning the room) Yeah? Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae jerks. Her eyes dart nervously around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit uneasy) I can feel his vibration. Yes, yes,  he is drawing toward us now. I can  see him coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julio! Julio! How is he? How does he  look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he is a very handsome man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Handsome?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In our Father's Kingdom we are all  handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understanding) Julio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks on dismayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is standing before me. He is  wearing a black suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black suit? Oh yes, yes. He was  buried in that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Santiago begins to cry. Sam looks around the room wi growing disgust. Then he leans over to Oda Mae and yells  into her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a crock of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae nearly falls off her chair. She spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is stunned. Clara and Louise look at one another in t confusion. This is obviously not part of the act. Mrs.  Santiago seems frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae screams and jumps up thrashing at the air. Her kn kicks the table and sends it toppling. Mrs. Santiago is  terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julio! Julio!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here! Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Santiago doesn't know what to do. She begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you talking to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara runs up to Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep him away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise looks at the empty room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you talking to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something. Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara just stares at her sister. Sam is excited and amaze

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe this. Hey you. My  name is Sam Wheat. Can you hear me?  Sam Wheat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say my name! Sam Wheat! Say it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me, Oda Mae. Say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam Wheat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nearly falls on his face. Clara's eyes widen. She is  more confused than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samweet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae runs into the closet. It has a false panel leading to a hidden chamber on the l side and she barricades herself inside it. Clara and Loui stand outside pulling on the handle. They seem frightened

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae! Oda Mae!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae is rocking back and forth on the floor praying. S feet enter the frame beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord, I swear, no more cheatin'. I  promise, Lord. I don't want to go to  hell. I'll do anything. Gimme a  penance. Just make him go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away. Hell no. I'm stayin' right  here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae screams, jumps back into the closet, and bolts up against the door. It tears from its hinges and falls into the seance room, nearly crushing Louise. Mrs. Santiago ru out screaming. Oda Mae takes one look around and collapse in a dead faint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beads of sweat collect on Oda Mae's brow and cheeks. She  seems feverish. Clara and Louise are sitting beside her w damp towels nervously soaking up the perspiration. Oda Ma appears to be talking to herself until we PULL BACK and r Sam nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mama, her mama, may they rest in  peace, they had de gift. Mama always  said I had it, but I never did. She  tol' me all about it, how it felt  an' all. But now that it's happenin'  I don't know what to do. You're  scarin' me half to death. Please,  you gotta go away, you gotta find  someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara and Louise look at one another with growing concern

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone else? Are you outta your  mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gettin' there fast. (she pushes Louise's  hand) Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not till you help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? I'm right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm standing right beside you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking his words) "I'm standing right beside you." (she pauses and looks  up) Are you white?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I knew it. He's white. Why  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louise looks at her sister and shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, damn it. You can help me.  There's a woman, Molly Jensen. She's  in terrible danger. The man who killed  me broke into our apartment. He's  going to go back. You've gotta warn  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would she listen to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has to! This man's a killer!  He's got a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, mister. I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a phone call. You're all  I've got. Lookit. I'm not leavin'  till you help me. I don't sleep  anymore, so I can sit here day and  night. I don't care how long it takes.  I can talk forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae gulps, a horrified expression on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The telephone rings. Molly, preparing dinner, runs to ans it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly? Is this Molly speaking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Oda Mae. I'm a spiritual  reader and adviser. (she hesitates) I'm calling for a friend of yours.  He asked me to call. This is  important. You gotta believe me.  Don't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a message from Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam Wheat. He asked me to call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly slams down the receiver, panting. For several secon she doesn't move. Slowly, she walks to the couch and sits down. She is trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't care what you do to  me, I'm not goin' nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is sitting on the edge of Oda Mae's bed, singing. It  sounds like he's been singing for hours. He is very hoars

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'm Henery the Eighth I am / Henery  the Eighth I am, I am / I'm gettin'  married to the widow next door /  She's been married seven times before  / And every one was an Henery /  Wouldn't take a Willie or a Sam /  I'm her eighth old man I'm Henery /  Henery the Eighth I am, I am / Henery  the Eighth I am / Second verse same  as the first / I'm Henery the Eighth  I am..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae bolts upright in her bed, her hands over her ears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay! Okay! I'll go. You just shut  your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Oda Mae are sitting at the rear of a crowded bus. She appears to be talking to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm doin' this. I  gotta be a crazy lady goin' into the  city with you. I never go there.  What the hell you doin' in my life,  huh? Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several people move away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae approaches the loft building and buzzes Molly's  apartment. She waits a few moments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nobody there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. I did what I promised. I  said I'd come and I'm here. I didn't  say anything 'bout waitin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one more time. Please. It's a  big place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae turns to leave. Sam, desperate, starts to sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) "Ninety-nine bottles of beer on the  wall, ninety nine bottles of beer,"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae stops. She turns back to the buzzer and rings onc more. Suddenly Molly answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) Don't go away. It's Oda Mae Brown. I  called you last night. Your friend  Sam says you gotta talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a CLICK as Molly hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly walks away from the intercom, shaken. Suddenly we h Oda Mae yelling up from the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you, Molly! You gotta listen to  me! this is for real. Sam is here.  He needs to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly walks over to the window and looks down. Oda Mae is standing in the street looking up. She is calling out at top of her lungs. Molly pulls back. She is afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He says remember the starfish at  Montego Bay? Remember the picture he  took a' you in Reno? (pause) Remember his green underwear, the  pair you wrote your name on? She  wrote her name on 'em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly tenses. There is a sign of recognition in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae is standing by the curb and shouting up to Molly' fifth floor window. Several people stare at her curiously She turns to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, do you mind? This here's a  private conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people turn away. She turns back to the window. Sam  prompts her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask her about the sweater in the  closet, the one she knitted that's  too big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the sweater you knitted  that was too big?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four sizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four sizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She couldn't throw it out. I saw. I  was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't throw it out. He saw.  He was there. This is for real. Hey  do you hear me up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WORKMAN peers out of a second story window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not talkin' to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't you ever heard of phones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss my behind! (yelling again) Listen, I'm not gonna stand here all  day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. I've had enough of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae is about to walk away when the entrance door open Molly steps outside. Oda Mae sees her and stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Molly? (Molly nods) I'm Oda Mae Brown. (walking over and  shaking her hand) You can call me Oda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Oda Mae are sitting in a booth staring at one  another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I believe you? Why should  I believe any of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl, if you think I'd come down  here for the fun of it, you got  another think comin'. This Sam of  yours... I don't know, lady. I mean,  you ever hear a whole night of "Henry  the Eighth I am?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did that? That's how he got me to  go out with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he cain't carry a tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Oh God. This is all so crazy.  I can't believe I'm talking to you  like this. I don't believe in these  things. I don't believe in life after  death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her she's wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says you're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking to him right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You think I'm makin' it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should I know? It's not like I  can see him. I just hear his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm holding her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he's holding your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I don't believe you. Why  are you doing this to me? I don't  believe a word you're saying. Sam is  dead. He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm holding her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he's holding your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly's hand jumps. Oda Mae looks at her. There is a long poignant moment. Sam chokes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I love her. I love her so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he loves you... so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) No. He would never say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his eyes brightening) Ditto. Tell her "ditto".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ditto? What's that mean, ditto?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly starts, an expression of true astonishment shining her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is pressed up against the edge of the couch listeni nervously as Oda Mae speaks. Sam wanders around the room, anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To tell the truth, I don't know how  I'm doin' it. In fack, confidentially,  nothin' like this never happened to  me before. Now, all a sudden, I can't  turn it off. (she sees a photo of  Sam) Is this you? Is this him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both say "yes" at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; to Sam) Hazel eyes, huh? You sound like they'd  be blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Why did he come  back? Why is he still here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause he's stuck, that's why. He's  between worlds. It happens sometimes,  when their spirits get out too quick.  He thinks he still has stuff t'do  down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on Oda Mae, stop rambling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, oh, now he's got an attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly stares at Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not have an attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Molly) We're having a discussion. (back to Sam) Whataya mean, you're not angry? If  you weren't angry you wouldn't be  raisin' your voice like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it, Oda Mae!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah ah, baby. That does it. I don't  talk to anybody who takes the Lord's  name in vain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up, as if to leave. Molly watches with growing discomfort as Oda Mae seems to be talking to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You relax. You're the dead one. You  want my help, then you apologize.  Nobody talks to me like that,  understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Molly) Excuse me, girl. Time for me to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae heads for the door. Molly is confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe I'm watching this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it. All right. I apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae stops, pauses a moment, and walks back to the cou Sam, relieved, paces back and forth. Oda Mae's eyes follow his voice as Molly watches her  curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Please, Oda Mae, I need you to tell  Molly what I'm saying. You gotta  tell her word for word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monsieur has a message for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, you're in danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't tell her like that. And  would you stop movin' all over the  place? You're makin' me sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly looks concerned. Sam leans into Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sayin' you're in danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danger?... What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the man who killed me. Willie  Lopez. I know where he lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he knows the man who killed  him, Willie Lopez. He's Puerto Rican.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly grows pale as she listens. Her forehead tightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Write it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Write it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm a secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae takes a card from her purse and grabs a pencil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 321 Prospect Place. Apartment 4D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 321? Hey, that's my neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae seems perplexed as she writes it down and gives i to Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, he's got my wallet and my  key. He was in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got his wallet and key. He was  in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (directly to Molly) You have to go to the police. The  Mugger wasn't acting alone. It was a  setup, Moll. I was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he was set up, that he was  murdered. He wants you to go to the  police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly stands up, afraid. Oda Mae stands up, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm sorry. I don't want nothin' to  do with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae heads for the door as Molly watches in a daze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't follow me! I've done all I'm  gonna do. (opening the door) I'm finished. And I ain't comin'  back. So don't you come botherin' me  again cause it's over. I mean it.  This is it. Have a nice life. Have a  nice death. I'm goin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lets herself out. Sam just stands there as the door s shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is pacing nervously. He seems very upset. After a mo he approaches Molly. Sam is behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, there's no one on earth who'd  like it to be true more than me, but  you've got to be rational about this.  I understand your desire to hold on  to him, but this... this is absurd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was real, Carl. She was real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to her, Carl, goddamn it. She  needs some support here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, you're a grown woman. How can  you believe some fortune teller from  Brooklyn...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was in touch with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it, Molly. Not for a  minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Carl. Open your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits down beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, she knew things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, the picture in Reno, the  starfish,... damn it, Carl. (with great difficulty) She said Sam knew who killed him.  That he was set up... murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh boy. This is getting deranged.  We're going off the deep end here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him the address, Moll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had a name, an address -- Willie  Lopez, 321 Prospect Place. She said  he had Sam's wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam smiles. Carl stands up. His voice begins to rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is sick. This is really sick.  How can you swallow this crap? Who  knows if this guy exists? Maybe she's  just setting someone up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I have to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out? What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam wants me to go to the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam wants you to go to the police?  Molly! Jesus! Are you outta your  mind? What are you gonna tell 'em?  Some storefront psychic's been getting  messages from the dead? Do you know  how that sounds? You're talkin' ghosts  here, for God's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly looks suddenly vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm sorry. This stuff just really  gets to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me. You don't  believe any of this, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half heartedly) I'm trying to, but... Look, if it'll  make you sleep any better, I'll check  it out, okay? Now why don't you go  to bed. Try and get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly looks at Carl, annoyed. She doesn't believe him for second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, in his red Ford Mustang, is speeding up town. Sam i beside him in the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl steps into the lobby of Willie's building. Sam follo wide-eyed. He seems both intrigued and astounded by what  Carl is doing. When Carl stops to read the apartment numb on Willie's mail box, Sam is thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Carl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl climbs the stairs two at a time and approaches Willi door. He bangs on it, loudly.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: opens a crack as Willie peers out. Carl pushes it hard an it opens the rest of the way. Willie steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, what're you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam freezes as Willie addresses Carl by name. He can bare move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared, in over his  head) Who've you been talking to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talking to? What the hell do you  mean? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some woman knows all about you. The  murder, everything. Where's she  getting it from, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you talking about?  I haven't said a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is staggered. His body is shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows your name, goddamn it! She  knows where you live!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of women know where I live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is fuming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a joke, man. You find  that bitch, whoever she is, and...  get rid of her, you hear me? I've  got four million dollars stuck in  that fucking computer. If I don't  get those codes, if that money's not  transferred soon, I'm dead. If I  lose Balistrari's money, we're both  dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him you only wash dirty money  on the first of the month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you? Is everything  a joke? You were supposed to steal  his wallet. You weren't supposed to  kill him. Was that a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually) I did you a favor. Freebee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! (sickened) These are drug dealers, man. (pause) Don't blow this for me, Willie. I've  risked my job here. I could go to  jail. A hundred thousand of that  money goes to me. Now give me Sam's  key. I'll get that address book  myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie goes to the desk drawer and takes out Sam's key. S unable to control himself, explodes in a fit of rage. Hau back, he slugs Carl with all his might. His fist has no  impact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed me, Carl. You had me  killed. Look what you've done to me!  Look what you've done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is on the street heading back to his car. Sam is bes him, yelling right into his face. He is screaming and cursing at the top of his lungs but C doesn't hear him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucker! You mother fucker! I had  a life, Goddamn you. I had a life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the distance, we see Sam smashing into Carl. It is l hitting the air. For all of his rage and bluster, there i nothing he can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, neatly dressed, exits her building and hails a cab She hops inside. Seconds later she hops out again, yellin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You white fascist bigot. Who do you  think you are? Bed Stuy's part of  New York, you know. This is America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver speeds off. Molly gives him the finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly exits a subway station and walks toward 131st Stree She is the only white woman on the block and heads turn a she passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Snow, you lost or sumpin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly pays no attention. Children run up to her, stare, a run away.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: When Molly turns down 131st Street, the crowds disperse a she is all alone. There is a sense of menace in the air. group of young men sitting on a stoop watches as she walk by. One of them whistles. Molly keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly sees Willie's building. She walks into the dank lob It is dark and full of shadows. Leaning close, she examin the mail boxes. Willie's name is there. She backs away,  afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dresser drawer opens and a box labeled "Sam's Things -- Valuable" is slowly pulled out. A hand reaches inside it extracts Sam's address book. As THE CAMERA PULLS BACK, we see that it is Carl standing in Molly and Sam's livingroo Carl opens the book and quickly jots down a series of cod numbers he finds in the back. His eyes sparkle with  excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is sitting in a room opposite DETECTIVE SERGEANT TH BEIDERMAN, 48, and SERGEANT DOROTHY WALLACE, 29. Both off are staring at her as she speaks. She seems very  uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you've gotta believe me. I  don't even believe this stuff, myself.  But this is real. Do you think I'd  come here if it wasn't real? You  told me to come if I had any new  information. Well, here I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officers don't respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Don't look at me like that. You guys  use psychics all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is dead silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Damn it. I know how this sounds. I  hear myself saying it and I want to  cringe. But this woman knew things  she couldn't have known, intimate  details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How intimate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things Sam only said to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smirking) Okay, let me get this straight.  According to this psychic lady, there  are ghosts and spirits all over the  place, watching us all the time,  huh?... (she stands up) I'm sorry. I've got important things  to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves the room. Molly gives her a dirty look and tur to Beiderman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you. The killer's name  is Willie Lopez. I've got his address.  You've got to check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Beiderman gets up and looks over to Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You just wait here. Let me see  if this guy's got a record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads out of the room. Molly sits back with an air of  enormous relief and gratitude. Sergeant Wallace comes int the room again and picks up a folder. Molly waits nervous After a moment Sergeant Beiderman returns with a police f in his hands. Molly looks up at him, and then smiles at  Wallace as she sees it. She feels vindicated. He lays the thick folder on the desk and opens it up. She hurries ove to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and reams of police paperwork. WIDEN as Molly stares at i all in sudden shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Where's your  file on Willie Lopez?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no file for a Willie Lopez.  He was probably some old boyfriend  she was trying to get even with.  This psychic woman's record goes  back a long way. Fraud, numbers  rackets, you name it. She's a real  pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT BACK AND FORTH between the records and Molly's stunne reaction. We see recent photos of Oda Mae and others goin back to her youth. They are fascinating and revealing. We even see photos of her mother and grandmother. In additio there are pages of arrest records and prison files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) 1967. Shreveport, Louisiana. Forgery,  selling false ID. Served one year.  1971. Baton Rouge. Arrested for fraud,  numbers racketeering. Served ten  months. 1974. Hattiesburg,  Mississippi. Fraud, seven months.  1984. Albany, New York. Petty larceny.  It goes on and on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is overwhelmed by the evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This woman's a charlatan. You can't  believe anything she said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't possible. There were words,  private things. How could she have  known all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ways? What ways?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got a million cons. A lot of  times they read the obits. All she  had to do was see the word "banker".  Hell, they even go through your  garbage to find things they can use,  letters, old papers. They don't need  much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I bet you threw stuff out, huh? It  could have been anything. What about  that underwear she knew all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Green underwear. I'll bet she zeroed  right in on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! She was real. She said things.  She knew about a sweater I knitted,  about songs we sang... She knew about  this place we went, Montego Bay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I know this is hard. People  want so much to believe. They're  grieving, vulnerable. They'd give  anything for one last moment... money,  insurance policies. Believe me, these  people know what they're doing. Look,  I know how you must feel. You know,  you can press charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly shakes her head no. Sgt. Beiderman closes the file. Molly sits for a long time. She is in terrible pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I wanted it to be Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Beiderman nods his head compassionately and then tur away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is sitting in her bedroom. The glow of the late  afternoon sunlight casts long shadows across the bed. She seems deeply depressed and alone. Gradually her gaze fall on a jar sitting on the nightstand. In it is the penny Sa found when they were first working on the loft. A label o the jar says, "For Luck!" In a moment of sudden rage, she picks it up and throws it against the wall. It SHATTERS o the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The code from Sam's address book, jotted on a piece of pa is sitting beside Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) God, let this be it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anxiously, Carl punches the code into a computer and,  suddenly, Sam's old accounts appear on the screen. A look relief wafts across Carl's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oh God, yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is staring at the same accounts Sam was examining th afternoon before he was killed, the accounts with too muc money in them. Carl picks up the phone and punches a number. Someone ans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Tony, this is Carl. I'm all set.  We're fine. Everything's fine. Just  tell me what you want me to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOICE on the other end begins to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want you to transfer the money  from the 12 separate accounts into a  single account under the name "Rita  Miller". Tomorrow, at five minutes  before closing, 3:55 p. m., transfer  the full account to First Island  Bank of Nassau, registry number 486- 9580.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl writes it all down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Call us when it's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
