dialogues.text: Tell Mr. Balistrari there won't be  any problems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl hangs up. He seems deeply relieved.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL SAM
dialogues.text: He is standing in front of Carl, watching. Quickly, Carl  begins punching commands into the computer. He is setting the dummy account. Rita Miller, #926-31043.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, in a short terrycloth robe, is sitting in a chair. magazine is on her lap but she is staring vacantly into t loft. She seems lost in the vast space. Sam is pacing bac and forth. There is a melancholy look in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you hear me, Molly? I need  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the BELL rings. Molly jumps. Molly's finger is on the intercom. She seems unsettled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, it's Carl. Can I come up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam freezes. Molly is surprised. She hesitates a moment a then pushes the buzzer to let him in. We hear Carl boundi up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't open it. He's a murderer, Moll!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a KNOCK. Molly opens the door. Carl seems buoyan almost celebratory. He has a bag of fruit in his hand. He still in a suit and tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Thanks. I know it's late. I'm  sorry to disturb you. I felt bad  about last night. This supernatural  stuff just makes me so uncomfortable.  I don't even read horoscopes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's not. You needed me to hear  you and I didn't and that was wrong.  I want you to know that I'm your  friend, Moll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were never our friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding out a paper  bag) Hey, I brought you some Japanese  apple pears. I know you like them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking the bag) Oh, that's so sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, can I come in for a minute?  I won't stay long. I've had one of  those days. Maybe a cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Moll. Don't do it. Don't let him  in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitating) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, in shirt sleeves and Molly in her robe, are sitting the couch drinking coffee. We notice that Carl is wearing yellow suspenders. Sam is beside himself, watching them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright? You look nervous,  upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at her thighs) What can I tell you. It's been tough.  Hell, you know. It still hurts so  much. (he poses sadly) Then on top of it all... it's the  responsibilities. They've given me  my own accounts, but I've had no  time to adjust. My mind has been  reeling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly reaches out and pats his arm. There is an awkward p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Where were you this morning? I thought  you were coming to the bank to sign  those papers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have time. (beat) I went to the police, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks at her, amazed. Carl, on the other hand, stiffe He laughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding. You really did it? I  don't believe... What did you tell  them? What did they say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right, you know. I felt  like such a fool. They brought out a  file on this psychic woman ten inches  thick. It was awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) A ripoff artist, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) Molly, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sad part is that I believed her.  I believed her, Carl. (pause) It was all a sham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relaxing) Sometimes we need to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?... I was a fool. I don't believe  anything anymore. Why would people  do such things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (milking it) It's hard to face reality, Moll, the  hard cold facts of it. What you have  to remember is the love you felt.  That's what's real. You have to  remember how good Sam was. How much  he loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly holds back tears. Carl reaches out tenderly and str her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You were everything to him, Molly.  You were his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally crying) I feel so alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not alone. You're young. You've  got so much talent. You're  fantastically gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appreciating his  words) Oh God, I don't know what's real  anymore. I don't know what to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just think about Sam. Think about  what he meant to you, the years you  had together, how wonderful they  were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl glides his hand slowly, lovingly across her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Let your feelings out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost imperceptibly, his hand moves down to the nape of neck. As she moves, her robe opens slightly. Carl notices glimpsing her nakedness beneath it. Sam notices, too. He  freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Life turns on a dime, Moll. People  think they have forever, that they'll  always have tomorrow. But it's not  true. Sam taught us that. We have to  live for now, for today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly can barely contain her tears. Carl moves toward her moist cheeks and kisses them gently. Slowly, he guides hi lips to her neck and kisses it, too. It is all hateful an sensual at the same time. Sam turns away. Molly feels Carl's tenderness, needs it. She does not not his hand reaching for the cord on her robe and slowly pul it toward him. With a little tug the cord unravels and th robe falls open. Molly is confused, aroused, not sure wha to do. She starts to pull it closed. He holds her hand. F a moment they do nothing. Then his fingers reach for her  thigh. Her body quivers. Carl feels her openness and pull closer, his hand rising gently up her naked body. Molly's eyes close. She says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam charges wildly at the couch and begins flailing  uncontrollably at the two of them. Unexpectedly his foot  kicks out and hits a framed photograph of him and Molly t sitting on an end table. The picture CRASHES to the floor the glass SHATTERING. Molly jumps up, the mood suddenly broken. She sees the ph and recoils. Carl reaches for her. She backs away. Sam is stunned by what has happened. He jumps up and trie kicking over another picture but nothing moves. His foot  goes right through it. Molly looks at Carl, drying her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. I'm sorry. I can't. It's  too soon... You've been great Carl,  but... I need you to leave. Please.  I need you to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. It's okay. I understand. I  really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches out and takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Look, what if we have dinner tomorrow  night? Just talk. Can I interest you  in that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly hesitates a moment and then nods her head "yes". Ca smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rushes madly down a flight of stairs into a subway  station. A train is just leaving. He jumps on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam begins quickly casing the aisles, looking for somethi It is not there. Another train can be seen speeding past window. Sam takes a running leap and jumps onto it, passi through the walls.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: disappointed. Suddenly, an express train passes alongside his local. Sam sticks his face inside it. Suddenly, he sm and rushes onto it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam does not have to stand there long. Within seconds, th terrifying Ghost he had seen before comes charging at him We notice him more clearly now. He is wearing a dark blue pea coat. There is a grizzled look about him. He has stai teeth and seems perpetually unshaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off my train!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time Sam does not back away. He holds his ground. Th Ghost lets fire every trick in his arsenal. Posters come  flying off the walls. A bag of groceries topples from a  woman's arms, an old man's cane flies across the aisle, a boy's Mets cap flips off his head. People on the train mo quickly to other cars. Unable to frighten him, the Ghost kicks Sam in the stomac Sam recoils, feeling it, but gets back up again. He is an now. He begins raging at the other Ghost. The Ghost is  shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teach me how you do that! I want to  learn! I'm not leaving til you teach  me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost, exhausted, looks up at him and smiles with  appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stubborn asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: SAM AND THE GHOST
dialogues.text: sitting in the corner of a deserted subway station. Sam i trying desperately to push a bottle cap with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What are you doing? What are you  doing? You can't push it with your  finger. You're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost demonstrates, kicking a garbage pail onto its s Sam can't quite tell how he did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your mind, you idiot. It's all  in the mind. The problem is you think  you're still real, that you're  standin' on the floor, that you're  wearin' those clothes. Bullshit! You  don't even have a body anymore. It's  all up here. You wanna move things,  you gotta use your mind. You gotta  focus! You hear what I'm saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you focus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how you focus! You just  focus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With surprising energy, the Ghost flicks a bottle cap and sends it shooting across the subway platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's all in the anger. You gotta  direct it. You gotta channel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm angry all the time. It doesn't  do a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause you're angry all over. You  gotta be angry here, in the pit of  your stomach. Bring it down here.  Let it explode. (he makes an explosive  gesture) It's like a reactor, you know. Pow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kicks a Coke can toward Sam. Sam tries to kick it back and misses. The Ghost laughs. Sam gets angry. He tries ag and falls on his head. The Ghost laughs louder. Now Sam i really angry. We see him forcing the anger down into his  stomach. He holds still for a moment and then kicks at th can with all his might. To his shock and amazement, it sa right through the Ghost's head. The Ghost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: practicing. He smashes at an abandoned tennis shoe with h fist. Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From your gut. What do I keep tellin'  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's stomach bulges. He tries again. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Give it time! What else have you  got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undaunted, Sam tries once more. This time the tennis shoe moves. The Ghost nods his head approvingly. Sam is thrill

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since they pushed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone pushed you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, someone pushed me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You don't believe me? You think  I fell? You think I jumped? Well,  fuck you! (an unexpected rage  starts to build) It wasn't my time! I wasn't supposed  to go! I'm not supposed to be here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Venom spews from the Ghost's mouth. Suddenly he rams a  cigarette machine full force with his head. The glass SHA and packs of cigarettes scatter everywhere. He throws him on top of them with terrible longing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'd give everything for a drag. Just  one drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rolls and wallows in terrible frustration, tossing the cigarettes in all directions. Suddenly he looks up and se Sam. He is unable to control his fury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Who the hell are you? Why are you  hounding me like this? Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: AN EXPRESS TRAIN
dialogues.text: is shooting through the station. The Ghost throws himself into it and in an instant he is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, all alone, walks through the station. Suddenly, he  reaches out and pushes a garbage can lid. It swings back forth. He is delighted. A beer can is sitting on a bench. pushes it off, watching it roll across the platform with  childlike glee. Looking up, Sam sees an advertisement for Market Security Bank and Trust. He stares at it with great interest. "Spe Banking for Special People. We make it easy for you."  Something registers in Sam's eyes. He yells and jumps str up, hitting a subway sign with his finger. With great  excitement, he runs for the stairs and rushes from the  station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ORTISHA JONES, a black woman with brassy red hair, is sit at Oda Mae's seance table surrounded by several of her  relatives. Clara and Louise stand behind Oda Mae helping  with the ritual. Oda Mae goes into her trance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GROUP OF GHOSTS is milling behind Oda Mae. Sam comes ba into the room and looks at them in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae, startled, jumps up in her chair. Everyone else j too. Clara and Louise look worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is all this? What's goin' on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do, tell every spook in  town about me? I got spooks from out  of town here. There's stuff goin' on  you wouldn't believe. I can't hardly  believe it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ortisha and her relatives look up, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae. You're doing it. This is  for real. How do you like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Look at this. You're doing  great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the GHOSTS standing in the background butts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hurry this up? My husband's  in the waiting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help, Oda Mae. There's  something we need to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. I'm not doin' anything.  You're holdin' on to a life that  don't want you no more. Give it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it up? I'm already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead, yeah, but you ain't finished  dyin'. Give up the ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how am I supposed to do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're asking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ortisha looks at Oda Mae. She has no idea what's going on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you speaking to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it look like I'm speakin' to  you? (continuing; to Sam) So, are you gonna leave or not? I've  got work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ortisha is totally confused. Oda Mae turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What's a matter? You're supposed to  be concentrating. How do you expect  me to do this if you're not  concentrating? Okay then. You ready?  Let's do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae and everyone in the room gets very quiet. One of ghosts draws close. Oda Mae's eyes roll up into her head. Then, suddenly, an extraordinary thing occurs. We see the spirit pull back and dive right into Oda Mae. Oda Mae gul Her nostrils flare. Her eyes bulge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Lord! Stop! Whatcha doin' to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae's body goes into bizarre convulsions as the Ghost tries to move inside her. She looks strangely stuffed and enormously uncomfortable. Sam and the others watch in astonishment as she tries to  speak, but nothing comes out. Then suddenly the GHOST speaks through Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Ortisha?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ortisha and her relatives jump up in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) Orlando! Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disoriented) Ortisha, where are you? I can't see  too good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here! She's here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of you! I'm right here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando suddenly zeros in on Ortisha. His eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother of God, what've you done to  your hair!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ortisha smiles excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando, do you like it? It's Autumn  Sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Oda Mae's body begins to shake wildly and her vo booms out, screaming with all her might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here, you little shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With frightening speed, she sends the spirit catapulting of her body. Clara and Louise jump up. Oda Mae is shaking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Lord oh Lord, don't you ever do that  to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Orlando!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is lying on the floor, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to me? I can barely  move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should know better than to try  that. It's not worth it. It'll wipe  you out for days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was incredible, Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never again. Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Orlando?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He spoke through you. It was amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more, uh uh, no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Orlando? Where'd he  leave the insurance policy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're great, Oda Mae! You're a real  medium. It's what you were born for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want everybody out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ortisha looks around the room, befuddled. Clara and Louis aren't sure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ortisha and her relatives scurry out fast. The ghosts, to begin passing through the wall. Oda Mae lays her head on table. Suddenly her whole body begins heaving. She is sta to cry. Sam is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out! I said out! That means you,  too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam hesitates a moment and then respectfully follows the  others through the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara knocks on the seance room door and peeks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae, there's a man here who says  he has to see you right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't seein' nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie pushes his way into the room. Clara isn't sure wha to do. Oda Mae looks up. She does not know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you the one that can talk to the  dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon! I'm not seeing  customers right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I need to know if you're the  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one. But not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is important. I have a friend.  He died recently. Some say he was  mugged. I think he was murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae stares at him curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm told you can contact people like  that. Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been known to happen. But it's  not gonna happen now, so come back  later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait til later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits down across from Oda Mae and shows no signs of  leaving. Oda Mae observes him quietly for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your friend's name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good question. Why don't you tell  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You're the psychic, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't no guessin' game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is it, lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookit, I don't know what your trouble  is... (getting nervous) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the mindreader. I hear you've  been tellin' people about me for  days. What's my name?

dialogues.speaker: ODA MAE
dialogues.text: confused and uncomfortable. Sam comes wandering back into the room. His eyes bulge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie sits straight up in his chair, amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm psychic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sudden thrust, Oda Mae sends her foot shooting int Willie's balls. As he recoils she knocks the table into h lap and rushes for the closet. We see her barricade herse in the hidden chamber. Willie, shaking, scrambles to his feet and, before Sam ca stop him, BLASTS his gun at the closet door. It is riddle with bullets. Sam screams out. Willie runs to the side do and escapes to the street. Clara and Louise come rushing Sam charges into the closet and sees that Oda Mae is safe behind the false door. Then he hurries to the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rushes to the sidewalk and looks in all directions. W is nowhere to be seen. He hurries back to Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is a disaster area, full of hysterical women. Od Mae is being dragged from the closet, unhurt but in a sta of shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to kill me! Why? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Talk to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her sisters start talking but she shoos them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae, we're in trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in trouble? Who's we? You're  already dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can stop them. But I can't do it  alone. You've gotta help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help you? It's me they're tryin' to  kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right. And they'll be back.  I'm your only chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go find a haunted house  and rattle some chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you Oda Mae. I need you to  get some fake ID's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fake ID's? What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me now, they'll never bother  you again. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping, thinking) Help you? Whataya talking about  exactly? What else do I have to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae, dressed to the hilt, is walking with Sam toward main branch of Market Security Bank & Trust. She seem and upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is crazy. This ain't gonna work.  I don't know nothin' 'bout bankin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll teach you. You'll learn fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they reach the entrance of the bank, they pass a pair NUNS collecting money to build a shelter for the homeless One of them holds out a collection box. Oda Mae passes he by, carefully avoiding eye contact. INT. MARKET SECURITY BANK & TRUST - DAY Oda Mae enters Sam's bank. She seems completely out of pl Sam, walking beside her, directs her every move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See where it says "New Accounts"?  That's where you're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (paranoid) I'm not givin' 'em any money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do what I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae approaches the New Accounts desk. She seems very  uptight. A woman OFFICER behind the desk looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her you're here to fill out a  signature card for a new account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to fill out a signature  card for a new account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And do you know your account number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her Rita Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rita Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing her oddly) Didn't they have you sign a card  when you opened the account?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her Carl Bruner opened it for  you by phone and asked you to come  in today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl Bruner opened it for me. He  asked me to come in today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer checks out the name and account number on her computer screen. It all seems to jive. She pulls out a ca from her desk and hands it to Oda Mae. Oda Mae stares at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just sign you name at the bottom on  the first blank line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae nods and starts to sign "Oda Mae". Sam stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) No, no, no. Rita Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the officer) Can I have another one please? I  signed the wrong name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam hits his forehead with his hand. The Officer gives he another card. Oda Mae signs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her to see that it goes right  up to the third floor file since you  have a transaction to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to put that in the third  floor file cause I got a transfusion  to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. (innocently) Umm, can I keep the pen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised, not sure  what to say) ...uh, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae, delighted, walks away smiling and gives the offi a wave. She is loving this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock on Carl's wall says 3:40. He seems anxious. The phone RINGS. Carl jumps. He pushes down the speaker butto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Carl Bruner speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Balsitrari

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balistrari? Carl, it's me, John.  I've got the info on the Bradley  portfolio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, yeah. That's great. I'll  pick it up later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up. His hand is shaking. INT. MARKET SECURITY BANK & TRUST - DAY Sam and Oda Mae approach a fancy part of the bank housing administrative personnel. They approach a GUARD who is  standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the guard you're here to see  Lyle Furgeson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle Furgeson, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have an appointment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm here for the fun of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that! Tell him Rita Miller's  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him Rita Miller's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one moment, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't embellish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning around) Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She waves him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Now listen, this guy Furgeson's a  real jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you whispering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he doesn't know) Just be quiet and listen. I've known  him five years and he still thinks  my name's Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the Guard leaning over Mr. Furgeson's desk. FURGES looks up and sees Oda Mae. He shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) He's a social moron. You don't have  to worry about anything. Tell the  guard Furgeson knows you. You spent  time with him and his wife Shirley  at the Brewster's Christmas party  last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this regarding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He doesn't remember me? We  were together at the Brewster's  Christmas party. With his wife  Shirley. They had that lovely tree...  all those presents. Why, I'll never  forget all those beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam pokes her. She yelps, surprised, and glances around. Guard gives her an odd look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oops. Gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She forces a smile. He smiles back and then goes over to Furgeson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This'll be easy. Furgeson was so  drunk at that party, he could have  had a conversation with Tina Turner  and he wouldn't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guard whispers in Furgeson's ear. Furgeson appears to flummoxed. He looks up at Oda Mae, embarrassed, and waves The Guard motions her to come back. She walks proudly ove to his desk. He sticks out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, hello. Of course, of course.  It's been so long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask how Bobby and Snooky are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are Bobby and Snooky doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perplexed) Why, they're just fine, thank you.  Nice of you to ask. And how is your...  family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't be better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, isn't that wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him you've been wondering how  they did on the Gibraltar securities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me, Fergie, how did you do  on the Gibraltar securities?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) The Gibraltar securities! Well, it  looks like we topped out, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We sure did!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We sure did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) That was a wonderful tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Good old Randy".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good old Randy. Got a real head on  his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Her" shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Her" shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure does. Well... well. So what  brings you here today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're closing an account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm closing an account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... wonderful. Do you have your  account number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up into the air. Furgeson eyes her strangely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make that 31-0-43... Numbers. I'm  dyslexic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He punches Rita Miller's number into the computer. A figu appears on the screen. He stares at it for a few seconds then punches it in again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be calm) Well, Rita, you'll be withdrawing  four million dollars from us today,  is that correct?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four million dollars?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say "yes"!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) Yes! Four million. That's right.  That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how will you want that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tens and twenties?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cashier's check! Tell him a  cashier's check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cashier's check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Of course, you realize we're  required to get some identification  from everyone. It's just procedural.  You understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae reaches into her purse and pulls out a DRIVER'S  LICENSE and a SOCIAL SECURITY CARD. Furgeson gets up and  walks away from his desk. He seems unsteady on his feet. OFFICER at the next desk is using a Brillo pad to clean a stain on her desk. Oda Mae smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if you put that Brillo pad  in the freezer, it'll last twice as  long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer nods appreciatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furgeson lays Oda Mae's ID next to her signature card. Th signatures match up. He nods his head in approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks up at the clock. It is 3:50. He pushes down a  button on the phone. A SECRETARY answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Bruner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the First Island Bank of  Nassau. It's on the rolodex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MARKET SECURITY BANK & TRUST - DAY Mr. Furgeson returns with Rita Miller's signature card an cashier's check for $4,000,000. Oda Mae's hand shakes as examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just need your signature right  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign Rita Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks up and gulps. Molly has just entered the bank a is heading toward them. He jumps up nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll be back in a minute. You're on  your own. Don't say anything foolish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae signs a form closing the account. Of course the  signatures match. Mr. Furgeson examines them both and smi He shakes Oda Mae's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you be careful with this. It's  like carrying cash, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (positively glowing) I sure do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rushes over to Molly. He is not sure what to do. He  notices a stack of deposit forms on the counter she is ab to pass. He hurries to it and flicks the entire stack, a  hundred sheets, flying up into the air. Molly, confused,  thinks she is responsible and stoops to pick them up. Sam delighted, flicks another stack. Oda Mae is talking a blue streak when Sam returns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Then my mother took all the money  from the oil wells and put it in  gasoline pumps. Every gas station  has 'em you know, sometimes six or  more. It adds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae, come on. We gotta get out  of here. Say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (abruptly getting up) Well, I've got to leave. It's been a  pleasure doin' business with you.  Say "hi" to Shirley and Snooky for  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Rita. I'll be glad to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae smiles and leaves. There is a new lilt in her wal Suddenly Sam looks and sees Molly about to stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up, Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that second, Oda Mae spots a quarter lying on the grou She stoops down and picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) What a day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly sees her, does a double take, and starts to go afte her. Unfortunately, Oda Mae steps onto an elevator before Molly can catch up. The doors close. Molly stops for a mo and then looks back across to the executive area. She see Lionel Furgeson and hurries over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is surprised to see her and grows instantly solicitous

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lionel, a woman who just left, a  black lady, about my height, did you  see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yes. I just took care of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she want? Did it have  anything to do with me? Did she ask  about Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not understanding) Sam? No. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was her name Oda Mae Brown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Rita Miller. She just closed an  account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly stares at Furgeson. She is not sure what to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitating, not sure  what to say) No. I guess not. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, in front of his computer, is going crazy. He keeps  punching buttons on the keyboard but the same response ap over and over on the screen. "RITA MILLER, #926-31043. AC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicked, Carl jumps up. He moves quickly, erratically ar the office and then back to the computer. He punches the  keys over and over. The same answer appears on the screen The account is closed.

dialogues.speaker: HALL OUTSIDE CARL'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Carl runs through the office. He seems crazed. People loo at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is someone playing with the computers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a joke? One of my accounts  is closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which account? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl freezes. He doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You want me to call someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing his demeanor) No, no. Never mind. It's okay. It's  all right. I can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. MARKET SECURITY BANK & TRUST - DAY Sam and Oda Mae are walking down the street in front of t bank. Oda Mae is talking to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae. Take the check out of your  purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops. There is a nervous look on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it out? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae, worried, removes the check but holds onto it tig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now endorse it. Sign Rita Miller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in shock) Endorse it? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's blood money, Oda. I was killed  for that money. Endorse it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're giving it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Away? What do you mean? To who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look to your left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae looks at the nuns collecting money for the homele She recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you outta your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what I tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! (clutching the check) I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you can. If you don't do it,  they'll track you down. Your only  protection is to get rid of it, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus, you're killing me, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saving you, Oda Mae. You'll go  to heaven for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae growls at him. With great difficulty, she approaches the nuns. The nuns look at her with curiosity and compassion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Write "St. Joseph's Shelter".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With great hesitation, Oda Mae begins to write. We sense  that every word is a torment for her. The nuns politely a their eyes from the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bless you, child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae gives her a dirty look and hands the check over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you talk to me. I don't want  you comin' round no more. I mean it.  Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we're friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends? Friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns on her high heels and wobbles away. Sam calls a her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're wonderful, Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She growls again. In the background we see the nuns secre peeking at the check. One of them, wide-eyed, faints dead away. The other nun stoops down and fans her face in an  attempt to revive her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is after hours. Almost everyone on the floor has gone. Carl, hunched over his computer, is typing furious comman on the keyboard. He looks haggard and worn. Sequence after sequence of coded numbers flash past on th monitor screen. Sam, sitting in a desk chair, watches,  smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search, you bastard! You'll never  find it. It's gone. (he smiles) They'll kill you for this, Carl. You  and Willie. They'll wipe you off the  face of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a moment of childish delight, he pushes his feet again the wall and the chair shoots across the room. Carl looks and sees an empty chair moving. He stares at it in confus and then goes back to the screen. He seems desperate. Not is working. Panicked and frightened, Carl flicks off the machine and  storms furiously around the room. Sam approaches the comp hesitates a moment, and then pushes the power switch. The computer CLICKS back on. Carl spins around. He stares at computer curiously for a moment and then turns it back of Sam, enjoying this, reaches for the switch and FLICKS it  back on again. Carl stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl watches as the keys seem to depress themselves and  letters begin appearing on the screen. He sits down,  mesmerized by what is happening. Then his face grows tens The word "M-U-R-D-E-R-E-R" is emerging before him. Carl flies out of his chair, frantically running around t see who else is on the floor. He yells out like a madman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Who's doing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no one there. He hears the computer beginning to type again and hurries back to look at the screen. One wo appears. "S-A-M". Carl gasps and smashes the computer with his fist. It cra to the floor. Electrical sparks go flying as Carl gasps f breath. Sam cannot hold himself back any longer. With a horrifyin scream, he charges at Carl, jamming his fist hard into hi ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard! You goddamn bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl grabs his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits Carl again. Carl gasps in inexplicable pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dinner time, Carl. Don't you  have a date with Molly, you creepy  son-of-a bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam keeps hitting deeper into Carl's mid-section. Carl do over as though he's going to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! Oh God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam is flushed with excitement. Carl kneels beside his de He cannot understand what is happening to him. His face g stark white as the attack continues. Then, unexpectedly, the assault stops. Sam, exhausted, st hatefully at his old friend cowering on the floor. Slowly and dizzily, Carl gets up. He looks fearfully around the  office and then, holding his stomach, hurries from the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, all dressed to go out, is sitting in Sam's easy ch asleep. Suddenly Carl arrives knocking at her door. He do not look well. Sam is with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl? Where were you? I thought we  were having...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Things just got so crazy.  I completely forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Carl had a little trouble at the  office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgot? I was worried. Is everything  okay? Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. I'm alright. Look, can I  talk to you for minute? Can I come  in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly eyes Carl with concern as he enters the loft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I need to ask you a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs to borrow four million  dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, I know what the police said,  but when you thought Sam was here,  when you thought he spoke to you,  what did you feel? What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very tense) Molly, that psychic woman, I want to  know what she told you. I want to  know what she said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, stop this. It was all a hoax.  I told you. It wasn't real. She's a  charlatan. (she hesitates and  stares at Carl) Does this have anything to do with  her being at the bank today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gulping) At the bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam tenses. He holds up his hand as if wanting her to sto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was sure I saw her. Furgeson says  she was taking out money. It turns  out her name isn't even Oda Mae Brown.  It's Rita Miller or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl turns white. His eyes bulge. He feels sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stomach. My stomach. Do you have  anything? Pepto Bismol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) Sure. Just a second. What's going  on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concerned, she hurries from the room. Sam digs his hands  into Carl's back. Carl jerks forward in intense pain and  begins flailing at the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing to me. Get away!  Get away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam does not go away. Freaked, Carl runs into the kitchen and rushes to the stove. Quickly he turns on the gas. He  looks crazed. Turning to the air, he begins whispering lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You touch me again and I'll set her  on fire. I mean it. I'll kill her.  I'll blow up the whole building if I  have to. Stay away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam jabs at the knob on the stove and begins to turn it o Carl sees it move. Shocked and frightened, he grabs it an pulls it off, leaving only the tiny stem in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Go on, try it again. Let me see you  turn it off now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, frightened, tries with all his might but he cannot t it. Carl pulls out a cigarette lighter and gloats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Try and hurt me. I'll kill her if  you hurt me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam rushes at Carl about to jam his full fist into his ch but then he stops, afraid. He pulls back, shaken. Carl st there waiting for a blow that doesn't come. He begins to  gloat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a matter? You believe me,  huh? You better believe me! I want  my money. I need that money and I  want it tonight -- at 11:00. If that  psychic lady doesn't bring it here,  Molly's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam freezes. Molly enters the kitchen. She grabs her nose

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Is that the gas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl acts as if that's the reason he came into the kitche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must have left the stove on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fiddles with the dials and turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Just glad I smelled it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, I'm sorry. I've got to go.  Look, there's something going on. I  can't talk now. Some trouble at the  bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble? What kind of trouble? Is it  that woman, the psychic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have time to talk now. What  if I come back? Around 11:00?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, what's going on? Let me help  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. I'm sorry to do this, but  it's important. I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Eleven!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae is watching T.V. with Clara and Louise. Suddenly jumps, aware of Sam's presence in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara and Louise jump, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin' here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae! We're in trouble. They want  the check. They're comin' to kill  you. We gotta get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The check? What do you mean, "the  check". You said they'd never find  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (afraid) What's happenin' Oda Mae?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red Mustang SCREECHES to a stop on the street below. Sa and Oda Mae run to the window. Carl and Willie are lookin up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're comin' to kill me. (to Sam, crazed) What have you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie and Carl jump out of the car. They head for Oda Ma building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam steps back from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're heading for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) Jesus have mercy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie forces open a back door. They head into the buildi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae and the others hurry into the hall. They rush dow the corridor and knock loudly on a neighbor's door. A WOM opens it a crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emergency! Let us in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you kiddin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Woman slams the door and locks it shut. Oda Mae looks frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Willie climb the stairs two at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae and her sisters bang on another apartment door. N one is home. Across the corridor an ELDERLY WOMAN sticks head out to see what is going on. Before she can say anyt they push their way inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin'? You can't come in  here. The cat don't like visitors.  She'll pee all over the couch. You  wanna pay for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae grabs the woman's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: just as Willie and Carl emerge from the stairwell. They h down the hall toward Oda Mae's door. Willie pulls out a g and fires. The lock shoots open. They rush inside.

dialogues.speaker: ODA MAE
dialogues.text: in the elderly woman's vestibule, peering through the  peephole. The old woman is struggling and still trying to talk. Oda Mae's knees are wobbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're gonna find us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No they won't. I'm gonna get 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? And how you gonna do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whataya mean? I'm a ghost, aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie moves quickly through Oda Mae's apartment, his gun pointed, ready to fire. He seems furious when he realizes one is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like someone just left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes back out and down the stairs. Willie stays in t apartment. Suddenly, the doorbell RINGS. Willie rushes ov and opens the door a crack. There is no one there. Confus he backs away. The doorbell rings again. Completely mysti he aims his gun and opens the door all the way. The hallw is empty. As Willie stands there, wondering what is happening, Sam  steps inside and pushes the door closed. It slams shut. W nearly jumps out of his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stares at the door in total bewilderment. At that inst a collection of picture frames flies off the breakfront a crashes into his legs. He backs away, spooked. Suddenly, the T.V. flicks ON at full volume and then the  STEREO and the RADIO. Lights begin flashing on and off. W spins around in total dismay. Summoning all of his force, Sam slams into Willie. Willie recoils in unexplainable pain. He seems very disoriented. His gun falls to the floor. He reaches for it and Sam pus it away. Willie jumps up, afraid. His eyes dart around th room. Sam laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Who's there? Who's doing that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of candle holders shoot off the mantle piece and n hit Willie in the head. He freaks. Grabbing his gun, Will runs into the bathroom and locks the door. Suddenly the h water faucet turns on by itself. Willie is terrified. Steam rises from the sink. Willie tr to get out, but Sam approaches him from behind and appear to dig his hands into his neck. Willie crumples to his kn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a SQUEAKING SOUND and Willie looks up. Letters a appearing in the fogged mirror. He stares in disbelief as the word "B-O-O!" emerges before him. He cries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Let me outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking uncontrollably, Willie FIRES his gun at the mirro Glass and tiles EXPLODE. Willie is cut and bleeding. He g hold of the door and yanks it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie rushes to the hallway, charges for the back stairs and stumbles down the three flights to the street. Carl,  running down the corridor, rushes after him. Willie drops his gun. Carl picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie runs from the building and careens down the sidewa People clear a path as he hurls past them like a madman.  Carl, confused, runs after him. Sam, too, races after Willie, unwilling to let him get aw Suddenly, a man obstructs his way. Willie goes flying ove him and lands face down on the cement. Before he can get Sam is all over him and does not let up. People stand bac to watch as Willie does battle with himself. Panicked, he calls out to a bystander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People back away. Carl watches in terror. He understands  exactly what is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie, blinded by his own hysteria, runs wildly into the street. Cars are bearing down on him from all directions. does not get out of their way. One driver sees Willie coming and swerves to avoid him. H car skids. Another car brakes to avoid a collision and  suddenly both cars crash right into him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Willie's body is crushed instantly between the two vehicl as his spirit is catapulted into the air still screaming writhing. His ghostly form reaches out to people for help they rush past. No one stops. Willie spins around and sees a mangled body crumpled on t street. Suddenly, he recognizes that it is his own dead b lying there. He begins to scream. A bizarre and frightening CLICKING SOUND fills the air. S looks up. A group of strange dark figures has emerged fro the shadows. With a loud, terrifying shriek, the dark forms swoop down and grab hold of Willie. Sam freezes. In an instant they dragging Willie, kicking and screaming, down through the  sewer grates into the bowels of the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam backs against a wall in absolute horror. Carl, standi in the crowd, turns and runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae and her sisters are huddling with the old woman i the entryway to her apartment. They all appear frightened The door is opened a crack and they can see people gather in the hall outside. Sam walks up to Oda Mae. She feels his presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead, Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead! (she utters a sigh of  relief) Oh, thank God. It's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not over, Oda Mae. There's  still Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae freezes. She turns to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Oda Mae are in a taxi speeding downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him to hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you hurry up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, lady, I'm going as fast as I  can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam leans forward and pushes at the gas pedal. The cab sh forward. The driver seems shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Problems?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her a dirty look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a KNOCK at the door. Molly goes to it. Fastening the latch, she opens it a crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae wedges her foot inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, it's Oda Mae. I know what you  think of me, but your life is in  danger. You have to listen to me.  Sam's here, too. You gotta let us  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly tries to slam the door but hits Oda Mae's foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of here. I'm calling  the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. We want you to call 'em.  You're in trouble. Let us in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's death was no accident. He was  murdered, Molly. Carl was laundering  money at the bank. Sam found out.  He's dangerous. He tried to kill me.  He'll kill you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Why are you doing this to me? Get  away from me! I know all about you.  You're a fake. You're just a fake.  Leave me alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Sam's inside the room with Molly. He gazes at her  lovingly for a moment and then calls back to Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her she's wearing the blouse I  spilled the Margarita on and the  earrings I gave her for Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam says you're wearin' the blouse  he spilled the Margarita on and the  earrings he gave you at Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: MOLLY
dialogues.text: grabbing hold of her beads. Her hand is shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) See, I'm no fake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a penny quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty your purse. On the floor. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae obeys. A pile of coins falls on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Push a penny under the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae obeys and a penny slides into the loft. Molly see it. Sam tips it carefully so it lands upright against the bottom of the door. Pushing gently, he moves the penny up the door until it's eye level with Molly. She watches it, amazed. Then, to her astonishment, the penny floats away from the door and hovers in the air. There is a look of wonder in  Molly's eyes as it floats toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing; calling  to Oda Mae) Tell her it's for luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam says it's for luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly stands there dumbfounded. Her face is completely wh After a moment she reaches for the penny. It falls into h hand. There are tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Oda Mae standing in the hallway as the door to the loft b to open. Slowly Molly steps out onto the landing and star at her, nervously, uncomprehendingly. She hesitates for a long moment and then invites Oda Mae in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is on the phone. Oda Mae is beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Yes, it's right on the corner.  We're a red brick building with the  entrance on the left side. Please  hurry. Thank you Sergeant. We'll be  waiting right here. (she hangs up) Police are on their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae takes her and leads her to the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a period of awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Sam here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sitting beside you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly reaches out tentatively. Sam meets her hand. She  flinches for a second but does not pull back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fingering the air) Can you feel me, Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all his heart, he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd give anything to be alive again,  just to feel you once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wishes he could touch you, just  one more time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae looks away uncomfortably. The CAMERA HOLDS on her face. After a moment she turns around and addresses the a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, damn it, you can use me if you  want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks oddly at Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come on. Before I change my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly he understands what she means.

dialogues.speaker: JUKEBOX
dialogues.text: Sam's finger presses down two keys. We see a record slide out of its slot and move toward the turntable. We know wh it is going to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae closes her eyes. "Unchained Melody" begins to pla Sam hesitates for a moment and then cautiously, awkwardly slides his ghostly body into her solid form. We sense Oda Mae's discomfort gradually give way as Sam emerges inside her. After a second her body turns slowly toward Molly. Oda Mae's hand reaches out and with slow, deliberate gest touches Molly's hand. Molly swallows hard. She closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam. It is as though he alone is there with Molly. His ey are full of tears. He can barely move. His hand glides sl down Molly's cheek. He seems to be in a state of ecstasy pain. The experience is more than he can bear. He pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly reaches out, takes Sam's hand, and guides it to her soft lips. Sam can barely breathe. He seems totally absor in the experience, the sensation of human flesh. His eyes are absolutely still and full of light. He seems be glowing. Gently, Molly takes Sam's arm and guides him to his feet. Effortlessly, she draws him to the center of the huge lof With great tenderness, she puts her arms around him and b he knows what is happening, they are dancing. It is a str touching image, reminiscent of their first night in their new home. Sam reaches out and slowly draws his fingers do over her face, caressing her forehead, her cheeks, her li She stands motionless. Her face shines. She knows beyond doubt that it is him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LOUD JARRING SOUND. It takes a moment to realize that i is someone KNOCKING at the door. The light slams back int its shadowy substance and Sam comes shooting back into hi ghostly form. Oda Mae is standing with Molly in the cente of the room. Sam is beside them. He appears shaken and di There is a another loud POUNDING at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly heads for the door. Sam calls out. He can barely sp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Molly) Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam tries to go instead. To his amazement and ours he is  extremely weak, barely able to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His ghostly functions are diminishing. There is another KNOCK and a voice rings out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly, open up. It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Carl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here! The fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae grabs Molly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae and Molly run for the fire escape window. We hear Carl yelling in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly. Open up. Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is standing on the landing. He is holding a gun. He  aims it at the lock and FIRES. The door to the loft flies open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl moves rapidly through the huge space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is obvious that no one's home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, with great effort, rushes at Carl and attacks him wi his fists. To his great shock, he has no impact. Carl wal right through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Oda Mae are climbing the fire escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl runs to the fire escape window. He looks out just in time to see Oda Mae go into the 7th story window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly and Oda Mae run through a new loft that is under  construction. It is a maze of tangled wires and broken wa The fire escape window slams shut and nearly scares them  half to death. They rush blindly toward the front door. I won't open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the fire escape. Head for  the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae reaches the fire escape window just as Carl appea on the other side. She screams. Carl tries shoving the wi open. It won't budge. Molly sees some scaffolding leading to the skylight. Ther is an opening at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly quickly climbs the scaffolding and makes it to the  roof. With a huge shove, Carl opens the window and rushes insid The window slams behind him. Oda Mae rushes back toward Molly, but her foot catches on loose cable and she falls to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help us, Sam!

dialogues.speaker: ODA MAE
dialogues.text: A hand falls on Oda Mae's shoulder. She spins around. Car is standing behind her. She screams as he knocks her to t floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the check. Just give me the  check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly looks down from the scaffolding and begins to screa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) God almighty, Carl! What are you  doing? What have you done!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She descends quickly and runs toward Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't interfere! She's a thief. It's  not her money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl kicks Oda Mae. Molly rushes at him, attacking him  violently. Carl aims his gun at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Keep out of this, Molly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Oda Mae by the hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae cries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points across the room. Carl sees the purse and yanks Oda Mae toward it. Yanking off the floor, he tears through it like a wild man. There no check. He grabs Oda Mae.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it, goddamn it? Where is  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying! Don't lie to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He aims his gun at her eye and is about to FIRE when,  suddenly, something shoves him to the floor. Carl screams and jumps back, tripping over Oda Mae. Sam is standing th In total panic, Carl scrambles to get up. Horrified, he S his gun blindly into the air. Molly and Oda Mae dive for  cover. The bullets have no impact. Sam musters all his  strength and shoves Carl again. White with fear, Carl gra Molly and aims his gun at her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'll kill her. You touch me and I'll  kill her. I mean it, Sam. Just give  me the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun is cocked at her temple. No one moves. Slowly the camera dollies toward Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Sam, please. I didn't mean for him  to kill you. It's not my fault. Come  on, Sam, give me the check. Give it  to me and I'll leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happens. Carl looks nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam? Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a wild explosive fury, Sam charges at Carl and smashes his gun. The weapon flies out of Carl's hand. Empowered b an anger we have not seen before, Sam smashes into Carl w a violent force. Carl's body careens into walls and  floorboards. Wiring snaps. Two-by-fours crack. Carl, crawling desperately to escape, sees his gun on the floor. With a wild rush, he grabs for it and shoots at th door. The lock explodes and the door flies open. Carl tries to run for it, but Sam cuts in front of him. W growing power, Sam sends Carl flying back into the apartm colliding into a tall scaffold. Bags of plaster topple to the ground as mounds of plaster dust hurl into the air. T apartment looks like a scene from another world. Carl, in a state of total unrelieved panic, breaks away f Sam. The dust obscures his escape. Like a trapped insect, scrambles furiously to the fire escape window. Sam cannot see him. Carl shoves at the window. It is stuck. With a supreme ef he grabs a ripped bag of plaster and swings it at the gla Half of its plaster spews across the room before smashing the window. Shards of glass fly in all directions. Sam tu and sees Carl. He surges after him, but knows he cannot g to him in time. Carl is halfway out the window when Sam's fist slams into electrical box attached to a dangling BX cable. It goes f toward the window. To his amazement, it hits the frame. A huge pane of glass dislodges and comes crashing down. Car looks up just in time to see the pointed edge aiming for chest. Before he can move, it pierces him between the rib and slices into his heart. His body quivers. Carl's eyes bulge from their sockets. His body begins to  spasm. He can't get up. A look of abject terror flashes  through his eyes. He tries to scream. There is no sound. tries to breathe. There is no breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With one last effort, Carl lurches forward. To his amazem his body stands up and pulls away from the window. He loo down at his chest and is amazed to see that the glass is  gone. There is no blood. Excited and confused, he turns a and sees Sam. For a moment, he cannot comprehend what is  happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a strange, silent moment between them. Then, seemingly out of nowhere, a terrible CLICKING sound heard. Frightening black forms are emerging from the dark Carl looks behind him and gasps. Past the figures coming  toward him, he sees his own dead body. It is pinned to th window sill. Before Carl can cry out, the dark figures swoop down and  envelope him. In a flash, his spirit is caught and surges with the dark forces back into the shadows. Far in some  invisible distance, we can barely hear him scream. And then it is silent. It is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly is crouched in the corner, her back pressed tightly against the wall. She is staring into space. The room is  filled with plaster dust. Slowly, emerging from the dust, see Sam approaching Molly. He gazes at her with terrible  longing. Suddenly, a brilliant light glows from behind the ceiling and the skylight floods the room with a golden haze. Sam  turns to look at it. His eyes are full of surprise and wo The spirits beyond the ceiling are beckoning to him. As h looks down, he notices that his hands are growing transpa His body is beginning to fade. A faint smile forms on his face. He leans down toward Molly, staring at her for a lo silent moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Moll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly's head lifts up. She looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam? Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Molly?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to cry. Gradually, we notice that the dust in the air near Molly beginning to shimmer with a subtle glow. To her astonishm Sam's spirit is reflected in the floating particles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Oh God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam's luminous form appears before her. Molly is overwhel by the sight of him. The two of them gaze at one another  without moving. They know it is for the last time. It is silent exchange, charged with emotion. Slowly, the two bodies reach forward. As their lips touch the plaster dust swirls sensuously through Sam's vaporous image and he begins to disappear. Molly pulls back from h as though from a cloud. His voice rises from the mist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stay anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears roll down her cheek. The brilliant light intensifies. It is beautiful, like a  sunrise, saturating the room with a warm, comforting glow Molly looks up and sees it all. Oda Mae sees it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're waiting for you, Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) I know. Goodbye, Oda Mae. (with deep felt  gratitude) Thank you. Your mama would be proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oda Mae smiles warmly. Sam turns to Molly. She is gazing at the last remaining  moments of him. Her eyes brim over with tears and love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Molly. I've always loved  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Molly swallows hard and wipes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ditto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light inside Sam intensifies. A sweet smile emerges o his lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so amazing, Moll...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His face fills with joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The love inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whispers, almost crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You take it with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are his last words. His spirit dissolves within its  ghostly moorings and begins to evaporate. Molly looks up  silently for a moment, her face filled with love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Sam's spirit rise from the room. It passes effortl through the ceiling and, in seconds, he is gone. The room grows dark. Molly sits quietly on the floor. There is a look of awe a wonder in her eyes. After a moment, Oda Mae reaches down help her up. Molly looks at her lovingly and then gently  takes her hand. Arm in arm, supporting one another, they  walk quietly from the room.
